case_vignette: A 26-year-old man presents to his primary care physician for a routine physical exam. He is concerned about a burning sensation that he feels in his throat whenever he eats large meals and is concerned he may have esophageal cancer like his uncle. The patient has a past medical history of irritable bowel syndrome and constipation. His current medications include whey protein supplements, fish oil, a multivitamin, and sodium docusate. The patient is concerned about his performance in school and fears he may fail out. He recently did poorly on an exam and it has caused him significant stress. He also is worried that his girlfriend is going to leave him. The patient claims that he thought he was going to be an incredible doctor some day, but now he feels like a terrible person. The patient also states that he feels guilty about his grandfather's death which occurred 1 year ago and he often reexperiences the funeral in his mind. He regularly has trouble sleeping for which he takes melatonin. The patient has been praying every 4 hours with the hopes that this will make things go better for him.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Gastrointestinal System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a burning sensation in my throat when I eat large meals.
Do you have any history of acid reflux or heartburn?
No, I haven't mentioned any history of acid reflux or heartburn.
Do you have any difficulty swallowing or pain when swallowing?
No, I just have a burning sensation.
Do you have a history of any stomach ulcers or gastritis?
No, I didn't mention any history of stomach ulcers or gastritis.
Have you noticed any blood in your stool or black, tarry stools?
No, I haven't noticed any blood in my stool or black, tarry stools.
Have you taken any medications recently that might affect your gastrointestinal system?
I'm currently taking whey protein supplements, fish oil, a multivitamin, and sodium docusate.
Do you have any existing medical conditions or family history of gastrointestinal issues? If so, please let me know.
I have a past medical history of irritable bowel syndrome and constipation. My uncle had esophageal cancer.
**Final Diagnosis:** Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD)
